name: CacheParser
description: For every asset that is cached, it will call the parsers test function the flow is as follows: 1. `cacheParser.test()`: Test the asset. 2. `cacheParser.getCacheableAssets()`: If the test passes call the getCacheableAssets function with the asset Useful if you want to add more than just a raw asset to the cache (for example a spritesheet will want to make all its sub textures easily accessible in the cache)

properties.name: extension
properties.description: The extension type of this cache parser

properties.name: config
properties.type:
Record<string, any>

    /**
     * Gets called by the cache when a dev caches an asset
     * @param asset - the asset to test
     */
    test: (asset: T) => boolean
properties.description: A config to adjust the parser

properties.name: getCacheableAssets
properties.description: If the test passes, this function is called to get the cacheable assets an example may be that a spritesheet object will return all the sub textures it has so they can be cached.
